files.description: Project overview and quickstart explaining how to generate multi-wave randomized intervention trial plans linking cognitive growth, ZPD social support operationalizations, and decision outcomes.
Python package configuration with pinned dependencies and entry points for running the trial-plan generator CLI.
Package initializer exporting the public API for building, validating, and rendering multi-wave trial plans.
Pydantic data models defining experimental arms, ZPD support parameters (type/timing/fading), measurement schedules, mediators/outcomes, and causal tests for transfer and durability.
Curated catalogs of intervention components, cognitive tasks, proximal mediator measures, distal outcomes, and example ZPD operationalizations used to assemble mechanism-oriented plans.

Core design engine that constructs multi-wave randomized intervention trials with specified arms (choice-architecture, debiasing, sleep-restoration), schedules, and logistics enabling within-cohort transfer/durability comparisons.
Causal-chain planning utilities that generate mediation/moderation test specifications, estimands, identification assumptions, and analysis-ready model formulas for longitudinal RCTs.
Randomization module supporting multi-wave assignment (individual/cluster, stratified, re-randomization) and producing reproducible allocation tables for experimental arms and ZPD variants.
Renderers that output the complete trial plan as structured JSON and human-readable Markdown including arms, timelines, measures, causal tests, and logistics checklists.
Command-line interface to generate, validate, and export detailed mechanism-oriented multi-wave trial plans from a YAML/JSON spec or defaults.
Example configuration specifying cohort structure, waves, intervention arms, ZPD support manipulation factors, measures, and durability/transfer comparison settings.
End-to-end tests that build a full multi-wave plan and assert required components exist (arms, ZPD factors, schedules, mediators/outcomes, causal-chain tests, and logistics).

missionDescription: Produce a detailed, mechanism-oriented plan for multi-wave randomized intervention trials that links within-child cognitive growth (executive function and processing speed) to reasoning and real-world decisions via fine-grained social support operationalizations (ZPD: type, timing, fading). The plan should specify experimental arms (nudge/choice-architecture, targeted debiasing, sleep-restoration), measurement schedules for proximal mediators and distal outcomes, causal-chain tests (mediation/moderation), and logistics needed to compare transfer and durability within the same cohorts.
missionSuccessCriteria: Specify at least three fully-specified experimental arms (intervention content, dose, delivery modality) that map to nudge/choice-architecture, targeted debiasing training, and sleep-restoration protocols.

Define a multi-wave measurement schedule (minimum 4 waves) that includes: baseline, immediate post-intervention, short-term follow-up, long-term follow-up, with explicit cognitive mediators (executive-function subtests, processing-speed metrics), ZPD social-support manipulations (type, timing, fading), and at least two policy-relevant distal behavioral endpoints.

Provide a clear analytic strategy to test causal chains and durability: pre-registered mediation/moderation models, sample-size / power heuristics for mediation effects, handling of attrition and missingness, and criteria for establishing broad vs. narrow transfer.

Deliver a concise implementation checklist (recruitment, randomization, fidelity monitoring, measurement instruments, ethical considerations) and a prioritized set of next steps for piloting within 1â€“2 cohorts.
